intro: Collyris minor, commonly known as the lesser collyris, is a small annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and has slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the carrot family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Collyris minor is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields.
